clinical_study.brief_title: Turkish Version of the Neurogenic Bladder Symptom Score Questionnaire: a Cross-cultural Adaptation, Reliability and Validity Study
clinical_study.official_title: Turkish Version of the Neurogenic Bladder Symptom Score Questionnaire: a Cross-cultural Adaptation, Reliability and Validity Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Gaziosmanpasa Taksim Research and Education Hospital

clinical_study.source: Gaziosmanpasa Taksim Research and Education Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Turkish version of the Neurogenic Bladder Symptom Score questionnaire: a cross-cultural adaptation, reliability and validity study

detailed_description.textblock: Turkish version of the Neurogenic Bladder Symptom Score questionnaire: a cross-cultural adaptation, reliability and validity study in spinal cord patients.

primary_outcome.description: The quality of life of the patients will be determined using Short-form 36. The self-reported questionnaire includes 8 domains (using algorithms) (0-100 points). Higher scores show poorer quality of life.

Neurogenic Bladder Symptom Score Questionnaire is a 24 item self-reported questionnaire(0-74 points). The questionnaire includes 4 subgroups; incontinence (0-29 points), storage&voiding (0-22 points) and consequences (0-23 points). Higher the score, the greater the severity of the symptoms.

The King's Health Questionnaire (KHQ) is one of the most widely used for assessing QOL in patients with urinary inkontinence.The KHQ consists of two parts and 32 items [7]. The first part (21 items) contains two single-item questions that address General Health Perception and Incontinence Impact and the following seven multi-item domains: Role, Physical, and Social Limitations, Limitations in Personal Relationship, Emotional Problems, Sleep and Energy Disturbances associated with UI, and Severity Measures for UI. The second part has an 11-item Symptom Severity Scale (SSS) that assesses the presence and severity of urinary symptoms. While the entire SSS is scored from 0 (best) to 30 (worst), the minimum possible score is 0 (best health) and the maximum possible score is 100 (worst health) for all other KHQ domains.

intervention.description: Neurogenic Bladder Symptom Score Questionnaire is a self-reported 24 item questionnaire.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Spinal cord injury patients
- aged > 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- spinal shock patients
- urinary tract operation in the last month
- Quality of life changes in the last month
- urinary tract infections in the last month
- bladder management changes or drug changes in the last month

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Gaziosmanpasa Taksim Research and Education Hospital
